projects.title: CodeBuster
projects.description: An AI-powered code plagiarism detector that identifies similarities beyond simple token matching, providing a more effective alternative to traditional detection software.
projects.longDescription: Developer on a 6-person team building CodeBuster, an advanced AI code plagiarism detector. The system uses TF-IDF features, GraphCodeBERT-based embeddings, and output-based similarity analysis to capture syntactic, semantic, and behavioral signals in code submissions.
projects.challenges: Trained an MLP to fuse token, semantic, and output scores into an overall plagiarism-risk prediction. Achieved 50% higher detection rate for plagiarized code and 37% decrease in mean absolute error through hyperparameter tuning. Project to be presented at the Canadian Undergraduate Conference on AI 2025.

projects.title: EasyAccounting
projects.description: A cross-platform desktop application for personal financial tracking with custom expense categorization and visual dashboards.
projects.longDescription: Built a full-stack desktop application using React for the frontend and FastAPI for the backend, packaged via Electron for cross-platform compatibility. Features include user authentication, local encryption, custom expense categories, and summary dashboards.
projects.challenges: Implemented secure local encryption for sensitive financial data. Currently used monthly by family members with plans for wider release including CI security checks (dependency scanning, static analysis) for stronger cybersecurity.

projects.title: Rust to Glory
projects.description: A Java/Swing educational game developed as a team project, featuring custom UI panels, character animations, and an inventory system.
projects.longDescription: Collaborated with a 4-person team to deliver an educational game for CS2212. Designed custom UI panels, character animations, and an item inventory subsystem. The project received a grade of 97%.
projects.challenges: Wrote extensive JUnit tests and refactored the MVC structure for maintainability. Used GitLab issues and merge requests for disciplined collaboration, resulting in an efficient goal-oriented team environment.

projects.title: Container Stacking Optimization
projects.description: Deep Q-Network agent for optimizing container stacking at ports, developed during my ML internship at Solverminds Solutions.
projects.longDescription: Built a Deep Q-Network (DQN) agent and custom environment for container stacking optimization. Incorporated lashing constraints to improve layout feasibility and reduce costs for shipping clients by automating stacking protocols.
projects.challenges: Researched supervised models (XGBoost, KAN) on hydrostatic datasets, achieving 0.09% Mean Absolute Percentage Error. Designed reward shaping and scenario simulators aligned with international port operations. Also mentored incoming interns, helping them join the team ahead of schedule.
